transcript: We started by falling down holes we didn't dig Following the pool of questions that kept getting big Found gems inside the rough stones that others walked right past Learned the satisfaction of making something last And somewhere in the stumbling, a language started forming Not words but something older, a knowing without warning This is the language we found by walking the long way around No one taught us, we just lived it, moment to moment We discovered the language we found We learned that patience wins it when hurry only lasts That chaos holds a spectrum if you don't avert your eyes We learned to trust the growing things over what machines produce That moving between spaces is its own kind of use Some things must come before others, not all weights are the same The order isn't arbitrary, the structure holds a flame This is the language we found by walking the long way around No one taught us, we just lived it, moment to moment We discovered the language we found There's a presence underneath it all, a slowness married to care A flow that doesn't grasp at things, just notices they're there And when you stand on that foundation everything else can rise The curiosity, the discipline, the courage to be wise We found patterns inside patterns, forms that make new forms A way of seeing structure in the eye of storms And some things can't be explained, they just arrive, converge Paths that started separate, meeting at the verge This is the language we found by walking the long way around Not invented, just uncovered, moment to moment discovered Brother to sister, friend to friend, beginning to end to begin again The language we found And if you ask us how we know it, we couldn't quite explain It's beautiful because it's mystery, it's sunshine because of rain We found it by finding each other, we found it by taking our time We found it by staying when leaving was easier We found it by walking the line The language we found www.mooji.org
